intro: Pyrus pohuashanensis, commonly known as the Pohuashan pear, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to China, specifically found in the mountainous regions of Yunnan and Sichuan provinces. This deciduous tree typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters and is characterized by its serrated leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The fruit is a pear-like berry that is edible and has a sweet, aromatic flavor. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
